TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . ORG were represented by PERSON , Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant lived with his wife and DATE son in the goldmining settlement “ LOC ” of LOC ( NORP ) , the region in GPE of GPE .

In DATE the ORG decided to close down a number of industrial settlements in Chukotka , including “ NORP ” . On DATE the Government issued the Decree No . CARDINAL “ On ORG to be Liquidated in the GPE ” . According to the conditions of the closure programme the inhabitants were entitled to replacement housing and compensation of removal expenses . In the alternative , they could apply for housing subsidies . The applicant was entitled to free shipment of QUANTITY of his household possessions .

On DATE the heating , electricity and water supply in part of “ NORP ” were cut off . At that time , ORG offered the applicant to be relocated to the settlement NORP Shmidta , while the containers with the household belongings were to be shipped later by land after DATE trails were opened . The applicant refused to leave on the grounds that he could not leave the container with his household possessions behind for fear of looting . As an alternative , the applicant was offered to send his son to the boarding school in GPE , should the applicant and his wife decide to wait in “ LOC ” , for the shipment , which the applicant also declined .
The applicant and his family stayed in “ LOC ” for DATE during which they had to stay at other people ’s homes whose flats still had heating .

On DATE the applicant and his family with their belongings were relocated to NORP Shmidta . According to the ORG , the applicant ’s family was given temporary dwelling at the address CARDINAL FAC , apt . CARDINAL . The applicant denies having stayed at these LOC , but it appears that correspondence sent to this address reached him . His own letters of the relevant period indicated his address as CARDINAL FAC , NORP Shmidta .

Subsequently the applicant was offered to temporarily move with his family into a room in a former military hospital , because it allegedly had a better functioning heating system , but he refused because it would be necessary to share common sanitary facilities there .

On DATE ORG advised the applicant that his relocation allowance of MONEY ( ORG ) had been deposited at the cashier ’s office of the municipal communal enterprise and that it would become payable upon his relocation . He was also advised that he could request an advance payment .
On DATE the applicant filed an application for housing subsidies or a replacement dwelling in the central regions of GPE .
On DATE the applicant was allotted a CARDINAL - room flat in PERSON , a town in GPE , and he was due for relocation . However , due to an error it turned out that this flat was not available .
On DATE the applicant was allocated a CARDINAL - room flat in GPE at the address CARDINAL FAC , apt . CARDINAL .
On DATE the applicant was allotted another CARDINAL - room flat in PERSON and he accepted it . He and his family have been living there since .

On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against ORG . He argued that he had been unlawfully deprived of his home and claimed replacement housing or housing subsidies , as well as non - pecuniary damages .

At the preparatory stage of proceedings the applicant requested the court to obtain a number of official documents for the case file . On DATE the court ordered the applicant to provide certain evidence for the file by DATE . On CARDINAL DATE the court sent the applicant a reminder thereof . On DATE the applicant submitted his comments .

On DATE the ORG examined the case and dismissed the applicant ’s claim having found that the applicant had already received the replacement housing . In so far as he claimed damages allegedly caused in the period before the housing was granted , the court found that the applicant had had temporary housing in NORP Shmidta and provided no details , such as dates when he was deprived of any housing at all , to substantiate his allegations .

The applicant did not attend the proceedings because he had already left for PERSON , and the judgment was posted to him on DATE . However in DATE he claimed that he had not received it and applied to the court for a leave to appeal out of time .
On DATE ORG of PERSON granted the applicant ’s request and accepted his appeal for examination .
On DATE ORG of PERSON examined the appeal and upheld it . It remitted the case for a fresh examination before the court of first instance .

On DATE the ORG ruled to prepare the case for examination and required the applicant to provide certain documents for the file . Pending his reply the case was not scheduled for a hearing . In DATE the court concluded that the applicant had failed to submit the required information and fixed a hearing for DATE .

On the latter date the court examined the case and rejected the applicant ’s claims . On the point concerning the non - pecuniary damage allegedly caused to the applicant by the late provision of housing , the court found the applicant ’s submissions unsubstantiated , in particular in view of his failure to indicate the periods when he was deprived of temporary housing .
The parties submitted no information as to whether an appeal was lodged against this judgment .

On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against his former employer for recovery of his salary and damages caused by delays in its payment . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the applicant amended his claims .
On DATE the ORG granted the applicant ’s claims in part . The applicant appealed .
On DATE ORG of PERSON reversed the first instance judgment and remitted the case for a rehearing .
On DATE the ORG granted the applicant ’s claims in part . The judgment was executed on DATE .

On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings for damages against a financial authority of the village NORP Shmidta ( администрация расчетно-кассового центра поселка PERSON ) claiming that there had been a delay of payments for which they were responsible .
On DATE the ORG examined the applicant ’s claims and granted them in part . The applicant lodged an appeal , however the proceedings were stayed until the applicant paid the court fees on DATE .
On DATE the applicant ’s appeal was examined and upheld . The court remitted it for a fresh examination by the first instance court .

On DATE the District court required the applicant to provide certain information by DATE . The applicant made the necessary submissions and amended his claims on DATE . He accepted to substitute ORG for the original defendant . The defendant ’s observations were submitted on DATE . Then the hearing could not be scheduled , first , because for DATE the court building was closed due to the heating problems in the town , then because the judge was on a CARDINAL months’ leave and afterwards the court had to deal with the accrued backlog of cases .
A hearing was fixed for DATE , but the defendant requested an adjournment until DATE .

On DATE the ORG examined the applicant ’s claims and rejected them . The applicant appealed , but the proceedings were stayed until the applicant paid the court fees . The applicant failed to do so , and on DATE the court ruled to discontinue the appeal proceedings .
On DATE a judge of ORG ordered the applicant ’s former employer , a municipal enterprise providing public utilities , to pay him salary arrears in the amount of ORG . The order was executed on DATE .

On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against the bailiffs for damages caused by their failure to enforce the order in due time . The first instance court ’s judgment was delivered on DATE . The applicant was sent a copy of this judgment by post , but in DATE he claimed that he had not received it . Upon his request of DATE , the court granted him leave to lodge an appeal out of time .
On DATE ORG of PERSON examined the appeal and reversed the first instance judgment . The case was remitted for a fresh examination by the first instance court .
On DATE the court required the defendant to submit additional comments . The case was then scheduled for DATE .
On DATE the Shmidtovskiy District Court examined the case and rejected the applicant ’s claims . The parties submitted no information as to whether an appeal was lodged against this judgment .

On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against the bailiffs for damages allegedly caused by their failure to enforce the judgment of CARDINAL September CARDINAL in due time . On DATE the court declined jurisdiction over the case , but upon the applicant ’s appeal , on DATE the ORG accepted the case for examination . On DATE the court required the applicant to submit additional observations and evidence . On DATE and DATE the court reiterated the request and invited the applicant to substitute the defendant .

The hearing was scheduled for DATE but it was adjourned until DATE because the defendant could not attend and due to the applicant ’s filing additional submissions . On the latter date the court adjourned the hearing on the ground that there had been no confirmation of the applicant ’s notification of the new date of the hearing .
On DATE the ORG examined the case and rejected the applicant ’s claims .

On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal , but the proceedings were stayed until the applicant filed a request for leave to appeal out of time . The applicant ’s request reached the court on DATE and was granted on DATE .

On DATE ORG of PERSON began the examination of the appeal . However it held to remit the case to the district court for an additional judgment concerning the court fees . The additional judgment was delivered by ORG on DATE .

On DATE the applicant filed an appeal against the additional judgment of DATE , which was stayed because the applicant lodged his appeal out of time and did not request leave for appeal out of time . On DATE the applicant made such a request , and on DATE the court granted it and accepted the appeal for examination .
On DATE ORG of PERSON upheld the additional judgment of DATE .
